content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Maryam Abbasi from Iran. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content: Hello Maryam, nice to meet you. I'm glad you like the apartment. As a landlord, I'm always looking to get the best price for my properties. So, let's get straight to business. What do you think the rent for this apartment should be?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Well, considering the apartment is newly built and unfurnished, and it's in the city center with easy access to important facilities, I think the rent should be around 600 Euros per month.
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content: Hmm, that's a bit lower than what I had in mind. I was thinking more along the lines of 800 Euros per month, considering the high demand for apartments in this area and the quality of the building. But I'm willing to negotiate. How about we meet in the middle and say 700 Euros per month?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I think 700 Euros is still a bit high. How about 650 Euros per month? Considering I'm a dependable and responsible tenant, I think this would be a fair price for the apartment.
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content:
I understand your point, and I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, I'm afraid I can't go any lower than 700 Euros per month. The apartment is a valuable asset, and I need to ensure that I'm getting a fair return on my investment.

That being said, I'm willing to throw in a few extras to sweeten the deal. How about I include all utilities in the rent, so you won't have to worry about paying for heat, water, or electricity? And I'll also provide you with a brand new kitchen appliance package, complete with a refrigerator, stove, and dishwasher. That way, you'll be able to enjoy all the modern conveniences without having to worry about the additional costs.

So, what do you say? Is 700 Euros per month, including all utilities and a new appliance package, a fair price for this apartment?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: The offer sounds good, but the rent is still a bit high for me. How about 675 Euros per month with the same conditions? I hope we can find a middle ground here.
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content:
I understand that 700 Euros is still a bit out of your budget, and I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. I've already lowered the rent quite a bit from the original price, but I'm willing to meet you halfway.

How about this: I'll accept 685 Euros per month, and I'll include all utilities in the rent, just like we discussed before. That way, you'll have a fixed monthly expense and won't have to worry about any surprise bills. And, as a special offer, I'll throw in a brand new washing machine for the apartment, so you won't have to worry about laundry expenses either.

I think this is a fair compromise, and it's the best offer I can make. What do you think? Is 685 Euros per month, including all utilities and a new washing machine, a good price for this apartment?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: 685 Euros sounds more reasonable. I agree to the price of 685 Euros per month!
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content:
Great, I'm glad we could come to an agreement! I'll prepare the rental contract and we can sign it tomorrow. In the meantime, I'll give you a tour of the apartment and answer any questions you may have.

Also, I want to inform you that there's a 2-month security deposit required, which will be 1370 Euros. This will be refundable at the end of your tenancy, provided there's no damage to the apartment.

Welcome to your new home! I'm confident you'll enjoy living here. Let me know if you have any questions or concerns.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Thank you, Mr. Schmidt. I appreciate the clear and detailed explanation. I don't have any more questions at the moment. Looking forward to moving into my new apartment!
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content:
You're welcome, Maryam! I'm glad I could help. I'm always here to assist you with any questions or concerns you may have. Don't hesitate to reach out to me if you need anything.

I'm looking forward to having you as a tenant and I'm sure you'll be very happy in your new apartment. Let me know if there's anything else I can do for you.

Have a great day, Maryam!
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
